form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Mikulski (for herself and Mr. Cardin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To renew certain Moving to Work agreements for a period of 10 years.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Keeping Moving to Work Promises Act.

section.header: Renewal of Moving to Work agreements

paragraph.text: the term covered agreement means a Moving to Work demonstration program agreement between a public housing agency and the Secretary pursuant to section 204 of the Departments of Veterans Affairs and Housing and Urban Development, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 1996 (42 U.S.C. 1437f note) that—

subparagraph.text: provides for the use of an alternative operating fund formula; and
is in effect on the date of enactment of this Act; and

paragraph.text: the term Secretary means the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
The Secretary shall renew each covered agreement for a period of 10 years.

paragraph.header: Prohibition on changes to financial terms
paragraph.text: In renewing a covered agreement under paragraph (1), the Secretary may not make any significant change to the financial terms of the covered agreement.
